value.title: Japan's Abe says Olympics to be held despite coronavirus pandemic
value.excerpt: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has resisted pressure for changes to the Tokyo Olympics schedule even as sporting events worldwide fall victim to the coronavirus pandemic. value.title: Japan's Abe says to work on package to support regional economies
value.excerpt: Japan’s government and ruling party will work together to compile a package to support regional economies that have been hit in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said on Saturday.

value.title: Bank of Japan says sets up coronavirus response team
value.excerpt: The Bank of Japan has set up a coronavirus response team headed by Governor Haruhiko Kuroda, the central bank said in a statement on Saturday. The BOJ said the team aims to help ensure the bank can continue providing essential central banking services.

value.title: Opinion: IOC right not to pull plug on Tokyo Games now because of coronavirus
value.excerpt: There is still no need to add the Tokyo Olympics to the growing list of sports and events that have been canceled or postponed. As much of the sports world goes dark in an effort to limit the spread of the coronavirus, the International Olympic Committee looks to be the outlier. It has insisted for weeks, and continues to do so, that it plans ...

value.excerpt: China, South Korea, and Japan are starting to reopen some of their museums now that their strict quarantines and testing regimens have staved off the spread of coronavirus. value.title: Japan's WANIMA Records New Song for Fans After Coronavirus-Related Concert Cancellation

value.title: Will Coronavirus Take Out the 2020 Tokyo Olympics?
value.excerpt: There’s growing concern that the deadly coronavirus sweeping the globe might force the first cancellation of an Olympic Games since World War Two. value.title: Japanese woman contracts coronavirus after contact with man who wanted to 'spread' it: report
value.excerpt: A Japanese woman tested positive for coronavirus earlier this week just days after being at the same pub as an infected man who told officials he wanted to “spread the virus,” according to a report. The man, in his 50s, ignored authorities’ orders to self-quarantine after he tested positive on March 4, just hours before he came into ...

value.title: Tokyo stock price fall reflects coronavirus threat to Olympics, say analysts
value.excerpt: Investors in Japan are now fully pricing in the prospect that the Olympic Games will not open as scheduled in Tokyo on July 24, according to several top analysts, because of fears over the coronavirus pandemic. The Nikkei 225 average closed on Friday almost 16 per cent lower over the week, as fears over the spread of the virus dealt severe ...

value.title: Japan approves emergency powers for PM to tackle coronavirus outbreak
value.excerpt: Japan’s parliament on Friday approved a bill giving Prime Minister Shinzo Abe emergency powers that will let him close schools, halt large gatherings and requisition medical supplies as Japan tries to slow the coronavirus outbreak.

value.title: Coronavirus-Driven Rate-Cutting Is Less Likely in Japan
value.excerpt: The Bank of Japan is hesitant to join the Fed and other central banks in cutting interest rates because its target is already below zero, and it wants to focus on supporting companies affected by the novel coronavirus,

value.title: Japan Airlines To Cut 1,488 Flights From March 16 -28 Over Coronavirus Concerns
value.excerpt: (RTTNews) - Japan Airlines Co., Ltd. (JAPSY.OB) announced Friday its decision to temporarily reduce domestic services between March 16 and March 28 in response to the Coronavirus or COVID-19 outbreak. From March 16 through March 19, the company will reduce 20 flights, while March 20 through March 28, it will temporarily cut 1,468 domestic flights.

value.title: Bob Dylan concerts in Japan canceled as coronavirus spreads
value.excerpt: Bob Dylan’s upcoming concerts in Japan have been canceled because of the coronavirus outbreak, the tour organizer said on Friday. The American singer-songwriter was due to perform 15 concerts in Tokyo and Osaka in April.

images.title: Bob Dylan concerts in Japan canceled as coronavirus spreads

value.title: Japan's Olympics minister reaffirms no delay over coronavirus
value.excerpt: TOKYO, Japan — Japan's Olympics minister has brushed off President Donald Trump's suggestion the Tokyo Olympics be postponed. Olympic minister Seiko Hashimoto told a news conference Friday that the International Olympic Committee and Japanese organizers are “not considering cancellation or a postponement, absolutely not at all.”

images.title: Japan's Olympics minister reaffirms no delay over coronavirus

value.title: Trump says still ‘lots of options’ for Tokyo Olympics, after call with Japan’s Abe
value.excerpt: TOKYO — President Trump praised Japan's preparations for the Summer Olympics and said there were still "lots of options" for holding the Games, only hours after suggesting they might have to be postponed for a year due to the coronavirus outbreak.

images.title: Trump says still ‘lots of options’ for Tokyo Olympics, after call with Japan’s Abe

value.title: Trump jokes that Japan is 'ahead of the curve' for greeting with a bow amid coronavirus outbreak

value.title: Japan Airlines to cut 1,468 domestic flights group-wide from March 20-28
value.excerpt: Japan Airlines Co said on Friday it would reduce 1,468 flights on 60 domestic routes across the group between March 20-28, citing a drop in demand due to cancellations and delays of sporting and cultural events amid the coronavirus outbreak.

value.title: Japan's Power Demand Hit by Coronavirus Outbreak: Industry Head
value.excerpt: Japan's power demand has been hit by a slowdown in industrial activity due to the coronavirus outbreak, Japanese utilities federation's head said on Friday, without giving specific figures.
